intro: Daphnopsis dircoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daphnopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Daphnopsis dircoides is often used in traditional medicine, though its toxic properties require caution in handling.
